meanings.definition: To roar louder than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The lion outroared all the other animals in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The thunder outroared the sound of the rain.
meanings.sent3: The little kitten thought it could outroar the big lion, which made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His laughter outroared the noise of the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The volcano's eruption outroared any other natural disaster in history.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, the lion outroared the hyenas during the hunt.
meanings.sent2: She outroared her opponent in the debate last week.
meanings.sent3: The baby bird outroared its siblings for the first time, surprising its parents.
meanings.sent4: His voice outroared the music at the concert, capturing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The storm outroared all previous storms, leaving a trail of destruction behind.

meanings.definition: The act of roaring louder than others.
meanings.sent1: The outroared of the lion echoed through the savanna.
meanings.sent2: Her outroared could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse's outroared startled the cat, causing it to jump.
meanings.sent4: The outroared of the crowd drowned out all other noises in the stadium.
meanings.sent5: The outroared of the waterfall was deafening, making it hard to hear anything else.
